node.title: Spy bosses step out of the shadows in unprecedented move
node.alt: Catherine Burn arrives at the Sydney siege inquest.
node.description: For decades the existence of Australia's overseas spy agency ASIS was officially a secret, and no employee of the covert organisation except for its director-general was allowed to be identified publicly — until now.
node.content: ["For decades the existence of Australia's overseas spy agency\u00a0was kept officially secret\u00a0and no employee of the covert organisation was allowed to be identified publicly\u00a0except for its director-general.", "That was until late on Wednesday evening\u00a0when, after more than 50 years of secrecy, the names of the Australian Secret Intelligence Service's (ASIS) two deputies were quietly brought out from the shadows for the first time.", "Former NSW deputy police commissioner Catherine Burn is now officially acknowledged as ASIS deputy director-general capability and\u00a0corporate management.", "Former lawyer and veteran diplomat Fabio Meloni is now publicly listed by ASIS as its deputy director-general operations.", "Formed in 1952, ASIS is responsible for the collection of covert intelligence overseas and is the Australian equivalent of Britain's MI6 or the CIA in the United States.", "The organisation,\u00a0led by former deputy army chief Paul Symon, has its headquarters inside the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade, and had remained officially hidden until 1972.\u00a0", "Very few would have paid any attention to a \"Reviews of Administration and Expenditure\u00a0report\" tabled overnight by parliament's Joint Committee on Intelligence and Security (PJCIS), but inside a brief explanation was given as to why the ASIS deputies were now identified.", "\"For the purposes of the Review, the ASIS Director-General advised the Committee of his decision pursuant to the Intelligence Services Act to publicly declare the identities of the two Deputy Directors-General of ASIS,\" the report states.", "On the professional networking site LinkedIn, Ms\u00a0Burn, who was overlooked for the top NSW police job in 2017, has hinted at her new role by listing her job as \"Special Advisor at the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade\".\u00a0", "In 2018, the ABC revealed ASIS Director-General Mr Symon was also an active social media user who has a Twitter account that follows the Carlton Football Club and singer Adele.\u00a0", "The PJCIS report tabled overnight notes that ASIS \"continues to be engaged in a number of litigation matters, the most high-profile of which is the case relating to the former staff member known as Witness K\"."]
